intro: Fumaria bulbosa subsp. cava, commonly known as the bulbous fumewort, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellowish-green with prominent dark veins, blooming in early summer. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
